summary: This document is an email chain from July 16, 2019, requesting and approving operational travel expenses for a victim interview related to the Epstein case. It includes a breakdown of travel costs totaling $1666 for two people.

persons.name: M M.
persons.context: Appears to be an official (likely from CACHTU) approving operational travel expenses for a victim interview in the Epstein case.

events.title: Approval of Travel for Victim Interview
events.description: An official (M M.) approves operational travel expenses for conducting a victim interview related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: On July 16, 2019, operational travel for a victim interview in the Epstein case was approved.
The approved travel expenses totaled $1666 for two people, covering flight, hotel, rental, parking, taxi, and M&E (meals & incidental expenses).
The approval references a specific EAN (Event Authorization Number) #457356.1, indicating formal bureaucratic tracking of the investigation's expenses.
